title: Watermelons

properties.name: description
properties.value: Watermelons are a Farming plant grown at level 47 Farming. Watermelons are grown by planting 3 watermelon seeds in an allotment patch using a seed dibber. Once planted, the nearby farmer may be paid to watch over the allotment. Payment is 10 curry leaves and optionally may be noted to save you space.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Watermelons

Watermelons are a Farming plant grown at level 47 Farming. Watermelons are grown by planting 3 watermelon seeds in an allotment patch using a seed dibber. Once planted, the nearby farmer may be paid to watch over the allotment. Payment is 10 curry leaves and optionally may be noted to save you space.

Planting the watermelon seeds gives 48.5 farming experience. If the farmer does not watch the allotment, then disease in the allotment may be removed using Plant cure, or using the Cure plant spell in the Lunar spellbook with level 66 Magic and completion of Lunar Diplomacy. If left alone, the diseased allotment will die.

Each watermelon, when picked, gives 54.5 farming experience. Once all watermelons have been picked, the allotment will be clear for new crops.

Farming info[edit | edit source]

'''Watermelons''' are a [[Farming]] plant grown at level 47 Farming. Watermelons are grown by planting 3 [[watermelon seeds]] in an [[allotment patch]] using a [[seed dibber]]. Once planted, the nearby farmer may be paid to watch over the allotment. Payment is 10 [[curry leaves]] and optionally may be noted to save you space.

Planting the watermelon seeds gives 48.5 farming experience. If the farmer does not watch the allotment, then disease in the allotment may be removed using [[Plant cure]], or using the [[Cure plant]] spell in the [[Lunar]] spellbook with level 66 Magic and completion of [[Lunar Diplomacy]]. If left alone, the diseased allotment will die.

Each watermelon, when picked, gives 54.5 farming experience. Once all watermelons have been picked, the allotment will be clear for new crops.
